thread.section_title: Sports - The Herald News, Fall River, MA
thread.title: Durfee football ends four-game skid with win over Nauset
thread.title_full: Durfee football ends four-game skid with win over Nauset

author: Mike Thomas
title: Durfee football ends four-game skid with win over Nauset
text: Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 10:12 PM Updated at 10:22 PM FALL RIVER – Eli Brooks rushed for 130 yards and quarterback Jaren Vieira chalked up 109 on the ground as Durfee snapped a four-game losing skid Friday night with a convincing 31-7 non-league football victory over visiting Nauset. All of the game's scoring came in the first half as Brooks rushed for two touchdowns and Vieira threw for two more – both to Nick Salmon – as the Hilltoppers improved to 2-5. Nauset remains winless at 0-7. "We needed to get back on track," said Durfee coach Taylor Brown. "I told them this was a new season and we're starting today 0-0." Durfee wasted no time getting on the board as Vieira connected with Salmon on a 37-yard scoring pass on the fourth play of the game. Vieira booted the PAT and Durfee quickly led 7-0. Nauset, coached by former Green Bay Packers head coach Mike Sherman, was unable to move the ball even after recovering a muffed punt on Durfee's 35-yard line after going three-and-out on its first series. With 3;40 left in the quarter, Durfee regained possession and scored with 1:03 remaining when Brooks broke free for a 54-yard touchdown to help give the Toppers a 14-0 lead. Brooks has rushed for 100-plus yards in all of Durfee's games this season. Brooks made it 21-0 on Durfee's first possession of the second quarter, breaking loose for a 29-yard score. Durfee struck again after Sakai Howard picked off a Travis Van Vleck pass to set up a 22-yard, Vieira-to-Salmon scoring strike with 3:23 left in the half. Nauset got on the board after Akeem Atkinson gave the Warriors great field possession, returning the ensuing kickoff to the Durfee 34-yard line. A 13-yard Van Vleck run brought the ball to the Durfee 16, and two plays later Van Vleck tossed a 14-yard touchdown pass to Sam McGough. James Tooker's extra point kick made it 28-7 with 59 seconds left. Durfee quick brought the ball into Warrior territory, highlighted by a 29-yard Vieira run and a 26-yard pass to Salmon, and with six seconds left, Vieira booted a 37-yard field goal to make it 31-7. "Coming out here and getting a win is big for us," Brown said. "Our goal is to be .500 going into Thanksgiving. Overall, it was a great team win for us."
